required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility of a Constant Pressure Skin Disk (CPSD) in Enteral Tubes.
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility of a Constant Pressure Skin Disk (CPSD) in Enteral Tubes.

brief_summary.textblock: Researchers are gathering information on one specific part of a feeding tube, known as the adjustable skin disk. Researchers are trying to see if a new type of adjustable skin disk, called a Constant Pressure Skin Disk (CPSD), can safely and effectively support adequate healing, and reduced complication rates.

detailed_description.textblock: During the procedure of placing a gastrointestinal gastrostomy tube (GIG tube) or GI jejunostomy tube (GIJ tube), the gastroenterologist or interventional radiologist will replace the manufacturer's external, adjustable skin disk with the external, adjustable Constant Pressure Skin Disk (CPSD) by sliding the former off and the latter on to the feeding tube.

primary_outcome.description: Number of devices that remain intact

arm_group.description: Non-hospitalized outpatients undergoing placement of a gastrointestinal gastrostomy tube (GIG tube) or GI jejunostomy tube (GIJ tube) will receive the usual Standards of Care related to the placement of a GIG or GIJ tube and the Constant Pressure Skin Disk.

intervention.description: The external disk is made of Dow CorningÂ® Silastic Q7-4850 liquid silicone rubber. Placement of the disk will be done by the gastroenterologist or interventional radiologist during the gastrointestinal gastrostomy tube (GIG) or gastrointestinal jejunostomy tube (GIJ) placement procedure. The gastroenterologist or interventional radiologist will replace the manufacturer's external, adjustable skin disk with the external, adjustable Constant Pressure Skin Disk, by sliding the former off and the latter on to the feeding tube.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age greater than or equal to 22 years
- Undergoing PEG tube or PEJ tube placement
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of tobacco or illegal drug use in the past year
- History of an enteral tube
- History of gastric surgery (bariatric surgery, Nissen fundoplication, etc.)

overall_contact.last_name: Paul A Lorentz, MS RN RD

contact.last_name: Paul A Lorentz, MS, RN, RD
